page.title: 14CABOURNE HIGH,NEW CLOSE WOOD
page.content: 12.7 percent of the Brocklesby estate is woodland totalling 3,500 acres containing 300,000 trees. About 900 trees are planted on one acre when all the trees have been felled. The oldest trees were planted 1889,being 96 years old. In 1985 11 acres were felled in Pillar wood and a total of 900 mature, trees were felled. Many trees are pulled. This is known as 'thinning out'. It encourages the best trees to grow stronger. In about 60 years time it will all be broad leaved plants. Every five years the owners proposed a plan of operations to the Forestry Commision detailing the proposed felling and thinning operations which they hope to carry out during the five year period. This plan has to be approved by the F.C. and also the County Planning Dept.
